name: ext_R4_AdverseEvent
title: Cross-version Extension for R4.AdverseEvent for use in FHIR R2
description: This cross-version extension represents AdverseEvent from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/AdverseEvent|4.0.1 for use in FHIR R2.

element.short: Medical care, research study or other healthcare event causing physical injury
element.definition: Actual or  potential/avoided event causing unintended physical injury resulting from or contributed to by medical care, a research study or other healthcare setting factors that requires additional monitoring, treatment, or hospitalization, or that results in death.
unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.definition: Whether the event actually happened, or just had the potential to. Note that this is independent of whether anyone was affected or harmed or how severely.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because it has a potential code that indicates the adverse event did not actually happen.

element.definition: Whether the event actually happened, or just had the potential to. Note that this is independent of whether anyone was affected or harmed or how severely.

binding.description: Overall nature of the adverse event, e.g. real or potential.

element.definition: Information on who recorded the adverse event.  May be the patient or a practitioner.

element.short: Who  was involved in the adverse event or the potential adverse event
element.definition: Parties that may or should contribute or have contributed information to the adverse event, which can consist of one or more activities.  Such information includes information leading to the decision to perform the activity and how to perform the activity (e.g. consultant), information that the activity itself seeks to reveal (e.g. informant of clinical history), or information about what activity was performed (e.g. informant witness).
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.short: Medical care, research study or other healthcare event causing physical injury
element.definition: Actual or  potential/avoided event causing unintended physical injury resulting from or contributed to by medical care, a research study or other healthcare setting factors that requires additional monitoring, treatment, or hospitalization, or that results in death.
Whether the event actually happened, or just had the potential to. Note that this is independent of whether anyone was affected or harmed or how severely.
element.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because it has a potential code that indicates the adverse event did not actually happen.

element.definition: Whether the event actually happened, or just had the potential to. Note that this is independent of whether anyone was affected or harmed or how severely.

binding.description: Overall nature of the adverse event, e.g. real or potential.

element.short: product-problem | product-quality | product-use-error | wrong-dose | incorrect-prescribing-information | wrong-technique | wrong-route-of-administration | wrong-rate | wrong-duration | wrong-time | expired-drug | medical-device-use-error | problem-different-manufacturer | unsafe-physical-environment
element.definition: The overall type of event, intended for search and filtering purposes.

element.short: product-problem | product-quality | product-use-error | wrong-dose | incorrect-prescribing-information | wrong-technique | wrong-route-of-administration | wrong-rate | wrong-duration | wrong-time | expired-drug | medical-device-use-error | problem-different-manufacturer | unsafe-physical-environment
element.definition: The overall type of event, intended for search and filtering purposes.

binding.description: Overall categorization of the event, e.g. product-related or situational.

element.short: Type of the event itself in relation to the subject
element.definition: This element defines the specific type of event that occurred or that was prevented from occurring.

element.short: Type of the event itself in relation to the subject
element.definition: This element defines the specific type of event that occurred or that was prevented from occurring.
The Encounter during which AdverseEvent was created or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.
The Encounter during which AdverseEvent was created or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.
The date (and perhaps time) when the adverse event occurred.
The date (and perhaps time) when the adverse event occurred.
Estimated or actual date the AdverseEvent began, in the opinion of the reporter.
Estimated or actual date the AdverseEvent began, in the opinion of the reporter.
The date on which the existence of the AdverseEvent was first recorded.
The date on which the existence of the AdverseEvent was first recorded.

element.short: Effect on the subject due to this event
element.definition: Includes information about the reaction that occurred as a result of exposure to a substance (for example, a drug or a chemical).

element.short: Effect on the subject due to this event
element.definition: Includes information about the reaction that occurred as a result of exposure to a substance (for example, a drug or a chemical).
The information about where the adverse event occurred.
The information about where the adverse event occurred.
Assessment whether this event was of real importance.
Assessment whether this event was of real importance.

binding.description: Overall seriousness of this event for the patient.

element.definition: Describes the severity of the adverse event, in relation to the subject. Contrast to AdverseEvent.seriousness - a severe rash might not be serious, but a mild heart problem is.
Describes the severity of the adverse event, in relation to the subject. Contrast to AdverseEvent.seriousness - a severe rash might not be serious, but a mild heart problem is.

binding.description: The severity of the adverse event itself, in direct relation to the subject.

element.short: resolved | recovering | ongoing | resolvedWithSequelae | fatal | unknown
element.definition: Describes the type of outcome from the adverse event.

element.short: resolved | recovering | ongoing | resolvedWithSequelae | fatal | unknown
element.definition: Describes the type of outcome from the adverse event.
Information on who recorded the adverse event.  May be the patient or a practitioner.
Information on who recorded the adverse event.  May be the patient or a practitioner.

element.short: Who  was involved in the adverse event or the potential adverse event
element.definition: Parties that may or should contribute or have contributed information to the adverse event, which can consist of one or more activities.  Such information includes information leading to the decision to perform the activity and how to perform the activity (e.g. consultant), information that the activity itself seeks to reveal (e.g. informant of clinical history), or information about what activity was performed (e.g. informant witness).

element.short: Who  was involved in the adverse event or the potential adverse event
element.definition: Parties that may or should contribute or have contributed information to the adverse event, which can consist of one or more activities.  Such information includes information leading to the decision to perform the activity and how to perform the activity (e.g. consultant), information that the activity itself seeks to reveal (e.g. informant of clinical history), or information about what activity was performed (e.g. informant witness).

element.short: The suspected agent causing the adverse event
element.definition: Describes the entity that is suspected to have caused the adverse event.

element.short: Refers to the specific entity that caused the adverse event
element.definition: Identifies the actual instance of what caused the adverse event.  May be a substance, medication, medication administration, medication statement or a device.

element.short: Refers to the specific entity that caused the adverse event
element.definition: Identifies the actual instance of what caused the adverse event.  May be a substance, medication, medication administration, medication statement or a device.

element.short: Information on the possible cause of the event
Assessment of if the entity caused the event
Assessment of if the entity caused the event

binding.description: Codes for the assessment of whether the entity caused the event.
